H0.text: Size of seeds and amount of solution used is the type of data the student should collect to determine the effect soap has on the growth of radish seeds when 30 seeds are placed in dishes with water, a 1 % soap solution, and a 10 % soap solution.

H1.text: Time of day and number of seeds germinated are the data the student should collect to assess the effect of soap on the growth of radish seeds when he places 30 seeds in dishes containing water, 1 % soap solution, and 10 % soap solution.

H2.text: Type of detergent and amount of solution used is the data the student should collect to evaluate the effect of soap on the growth of 30 radish seeds, which were placed in dishes containing water, a 1 % soap solution, and a 10 % soap solution.

H3.text: Number of seeds germinated and average length of shoot are the types of data the student should collect to determine the effect of soap on the growth of radish seeds, using 30 seeds placed in dishes with water, 1 % soap solution, and 10 % soap solution.

A5.text: Seed germination depends on both internal and external conditions.
